revised_title: Structural and Developmental Analysis of Normal and Mutant Eyes in Gammarus chevreuxi
tldr: The authors studied the structure and development of normal and mutant eyes in Gammarus chevreuxi, focusing on the eyes' microscopic structure and embryonic development. They investigated various eye types, including "red," "black no-white," "albino," and "colourless," and analyzed the relationship between the eyes and the central nervous system. The research also explored pigment migration in the retinula and its role in protecting receptor elements in different light intensities.
